Binance has locked my account with a lot of fund for over 4 months now. I have been using Binance for over 2 years and have never violated any of their rules. One day, they suddenly locked my account and refused to allow any fund withdrawals. I provided all the information they requested through the chat window, but they robotically repeat messages, telling me they cannot provide any information about the account review and to patiently wait.I even wrote a letter to Binance's CEO, Mr. Teng, but received no response. Additionally, their customer service is the worst. Despite numerous chats with customer support over 4 months, they mentally harassed me by deflecting issues back and forth and, in some cases, closing the case without resolving the problem, intentionally it seems.The money locked by Binance constitutes a significant portion of my family's finances. My family has been unhappy throughout these periods. Eventually, I fell into depression and had to seek treatment from a doctor due to the mental and financial abuse.This is clearly psychological abuse and financial extortion. I plan to take legal action on this matter and share my dreadful experience on social media. My case number is 121154260. If this issue is resolved promptly, I will update my review.

My feedback is regarding BinanceUS which is the U.S. exchange arm of Binance.I have attempted to open an Institutional account with them which requires submitting business documents for verification.Their standard wait time for approval is 2 weeks and the site recommends to contact support if not completed in this time frame.  It has now been 4 weeks and I have contacted support agents at least 3 times since.  These people (only available via chat) have been completely useless; they cannot provide any information regarding status or timing for approval, or even if anyone has even reviewed any of the documents.They cannot escalate me to anyone who is capable of helping with the issue.  They only claim that someone from their email support team will contact me at sometime in the future but cannot provide any timing for that either.  It has been 2 weeks since my first contact with support and to date I have received no contact whatsoever.  Additionally every agent always end the chat with a flag that says "This issue has been marked as solved" when it clearly is not.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Beware of Deceptive Trader Labels on Binance
list_of_reviews.review: [Update] Case ID #121488440I feel compelled to share my experience with Binance in the hope of preventing others from falling victim to their deceptive practices. As a user of their platform, I was led to believe that I was investing with reputable traders based on the labels and tags assigned to their profiles by binance themselves. However, it quickly became apparent that these labels were nothing more than a facade designed to lure unsuspecting investors.One such trader, 'Jasmine_Gemhunter88', was prominently labeled as a 'Top performer' and touted as the 'best trader for new copiers'. Trusting in these endorsements from Binance, I invested a significant portion of my savings in copying this trader's trades, only to discover that their strategies were reckless and irresponsible.Instead of following sound trading principles, 'Jasmine_Gemhunter88' engaged in actions that resulted in substantial losses for myself and many others. It became evident that Binance's labeling system was misleading and did not accurately reflect the trader's true performance or intentions.I urge anyone considering using Binance to exercise caution and thoroughly research any traders they may be considering copying. Do not rely solely on the labels and tags provided by Binance, as they are not accurately represent the trader's actual performance or level of trustworthiness. The most obvious evidence of this that after my loss and complaints to binance they removed those tags from that trader's account.In conclusion, my experience with Binance has been one of disappointment and huge financial loss. I hope that by sharing my story, others can avoid falling into the same trap and protect themselves from similar experiences.Stay vigilant and beware of Binance's deceptive trader labels.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Beware of Binance: A Cautionary Tale
list_of_reviews.review: I wish I had read the warning signs before diving into the abyss of Binance. My experience with this platform has been nothing short of a nightmare. From their opaque fee structures to their questionable customer service, Binance epitomizes everything that's wrong with the cryptocurrency exchange industry.First and foremost, let's talk about their fees. Hidden charges seem to be Binance's specialty. What starts as a seemingly low transaction fee quickly balloons into an exorbitant sum when you try to withdraw your funds. And good luck trying to decipher their fee schedule – it's like navigating a maze designed to confuse and frustrate unsuspecting users.But the real kicker is their customer service – or lack thereof. It's like shouting into the void. When you encounter an issue, which you inevitably will, don't expect any timely resolution or even a semblance of human interaction. Binance's customer support is as responsive as a brick wall, leaving you stranded with your problems and your dwindling faith in humanity.And let's not forget about security – or the lack thereof. Binance has had its fair share of security breaches, leaving users vulnerable to hacks and theft. It's a ticking time bomb waiting to explode, and you're left holding the bag when it inevitably does.In conclusion, steer clear of Binance unless you enjoy financial frustration and existential dread. There are plenty of other cryptocurrency exchanges out there that actually value their customers and prioritize transparency and security. Don't make the same mistake I did – run, don't walk, away from Binance. Your sanity and your bank account will thank you.

Title: Beware: Binance's Trust DeficitRating: ★☆☆☆☆ (1/5)Review:I'm deeply disappointed with my recent experience with Binance. What started as a promising platform for cryptocurrency trading has quickly devolved into a nightmare of lost funds and abysmal customer service.This morning, I reached out to Binance's customer service regarding a glaring discrepancy in my account. Despite depositing approximately $950 into my Ethereum account and only withdrawing around $350, there's a glaring gap of $600 or $550, considering fees. Basic arithmetic, right? Not according to Binance's customer service team, who seemed intent on gaslighting me into doubting my own sanity.Their feeble attempts at explanation, pointing fingers at Bitcoin transactions and other vague excuses, only compounded my frustration. The ledger doesn't lie, and there's simply no accounting for the missing funds. It's not just about the money; it's about the lack of transparency and accountability from a platform I once trusted with my investments.To add insult to injury, my account balance now reads a measly $28, a laughable sum considering the significant investment I've made. It feels like nothing short of robbery. In light of this egregious mishandling of funds and appalling customer service, I've withdrawn over $10,000 from Binance and vowed never to return.In conclusion, steer clear of Binance unless you want to risk losing your hard-earned money to a company that seems more interested in making excuses than resolving issues. Trust is the bedrock of any financial institution, and unfortunately, Binance has shattered that trust beyond repair.

Binance, one of the world's largest and most popular cryptocurrency exchanges, prides itself on its efficient services and quick customer response times. However, recently, there has been a noticeable slowdown in their customer support department, leaving many users frustrated and dissatisfied.As a loyal Binance user for several years, I have always found their customer service to be top-notch. Any issues I encountered were swiftly resolved, and I could always count on a timely response from their team. So, when I found myself facing an unexpected problem with my account, I naturally turned to Binance for help.To my surprise, days passed with no response from their customer support team. I sent multiple messages through their website and social media channels, but all I received were automated responses assuring me that my inquiry was being looked into. Frustration began to set in as I watched my issue go unresolved, and I couldn't help but wonder what had caused this sudden delay in their usually prompt customer service.As more time passed, I started to see similar complaints from other users on online forums and social media platforms. Many were experiencing long wait times and delayed responses from Binance's support team, with some reporting that they had been waiting for weeks without any resolution to their problems.The once shining reputation of Binance's customer service was starting to tarnish, and users were becoming increasingly disillusioned with the exchange. Rumors began to circulate about possible internal issues within the company, causing the slowdown in customer support response times.Despite the setbacks, I remained hopeful that Binance would address the issue and restore their previous level of customer service excellence. As a valuable and loyal customer, I believed that they would do everything in their power to rectify the situation and regain the trust of their users.In the end, Binance did take steps to improve their customer support response times, hiring additional staff and implementing new systems to streamline their processes. The slowdown was eventually resolved, and once again, users could rely on Binance for efficient and effective customer service.Through this experience, I learned that even the most reliable and reputable companies can face challenges that affect their ability to provide top-notch service. It is during these times of struggle that true customer loyalty is tested, and I am pleased to say that Binance passed the test with flying colors in my book.
